alert.note: Alert for Northern Elko County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 9:53AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Gusty winds, colder temps and rain and snow showers for Memorial Day weekend... A cold upper-level system will bring showers through Memorial Day, with a few thunderstorms possible. Breezy to windy conditions expected each afternoon and evening as well. Much cooler temps Sunday and Monday with highs in the mid 40s to 50s. Mountain snow expected tonight through Monday and a few inches possible. Snow levels could dip down to valley locations Sunday into Monday, but little to no accumulation expected. While not in the official growing season, overnight temps will be trending lower the next few nights. Beginning tonight some valley locations will see low temperatures drop into the low to mid 30s. Sunday night and Monday night the temperatures will be the coldest, with many locations dropping into the 20s. Anyone with sensitive plants or animals outside should monitor the temperature forecasts these next few nights and take appropriate preventative measures. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
